actions.start

Class ActionStartApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractAction
      • actions.start.ActionStartApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.Action

    public class ActionStartApplication
extends javax.swing.AbstractAction
    Singleton class that extends AbstractAction. It tries to connect to database via StartDialog and if it's successful it'll open LoginDialog.
    Author:
    Milan Radeta, Borko ArsoviÄ‡
    See Also:
    AbstractAction, StartDialog, LoginDialog, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ActionStartApplication getInstance()
        Returns the only instance of ActionStartApplication object. If it does not exist, it will be created.
        Returns:
        ActionStartApplication

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent arg0)
        Tries to connect to database specified by IP field in StartDialog . It either tries to connect to UNS (192.168.77.230/psw-2015-tim3-1) or Other (147.91.175.155/psw-2015-tim3-1). Before that it disables StartDialog's combo boxes, actions and sets default close operation to WindowConstants.DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE.. If login timeout of 5 seconds ticks out or an exception is thrown status will say connection is invalid. Otherwise, LoginDialog will be opened.

      • getStartDialog

        public StartDialog getStartDialog()
        Returns StartDialog ActionStartApplication is linked to.
        Returns:
        StartDialog

      • setStartDialog

        public void setStartDialog(StartDialog startDialog)
        Sets StartDialog ActionStartApplication is linked to.
